description.value: The digital (virtual) Encounter is caracterized as an encounter that uses some technological mean to perform the encounter instead of a face-to-face meeting.

short.value: An digital/virtual interaction during which services are provided to the patient

definition.value:
The digital (virtual) Encounter is caracterized as an encounter that uses some technological mean to perform the encounter instead of a face-to-face meeting.
An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

comment.value: The use-case in question is performing a virtual encounter using a camera device to perform the encounter.

definition.value:
The device used in the patient encounter. For example, a particular camera device
VKP-norway: Should be a logical reference containing the IMEI/serial number of the device. display value should contain the name of the device type. Could also contain a display name of the device

Unique code or number identifying the Encounter
VKP project uses UUID.
Example: ~~~ "identifier": [ { "system":"urn:ietf:rfc:3986", "value":"urn:uuid:a76d9bbf-f293-4fb7-ad4c-2851cac77162" } ] ~~~

The actual uniqe identifier (UUID)
The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.
VKP uses a valueset for encounter class for digital Encounter http://ehelse.no/fhir/ValueSet/vkp-encounter-class-v06
VKP uses http://ehelse.no/fhir/CodeSystem/vkp-encounter-class-v06 The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

Devices used during the patient encounter. For example, a particular camera device.
VKP-norway: Should contain a displaynames of the devices
VKP uses a valueset for encounter class for digital Encounter http://ehelse.no/fhir/ValueSet/vkp-encounter-class-v06

Time period for the digital encounter, the system should provide both start and end times. If the start-time is not known a single end time can be provided as a timestamp for the Encounter.
Example code: ~~~ "period":{ "start":"2018-06-25T09:56:23.945+02:00", "end":"2018-06-25T10:01:03.936+02:00" } ~~~
Encounter type tilsyn|hendelse

short.value: The patient or group present at the encounter

definition.value:
Reference to the patient that is subject to the encounter, identified by Norwegian national id number (Fødselsnummer or DNR).
A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.
VKP always references a Patient Resource using a norwegian national id number (Fødslesnummer or DNR) in a logical identifier in the subject.identifier element. The Name of the patient should be given in the subject.display element.
Example: ~~~~ "subject":{ "identifier":{ "system":"urn:oid:2.16.578.1.12.4.1.4.1", "value":"05073500186" }, "display":"Ærlend Sørgård" } ~~~~

short.value: Refernce to the individual that participated in the encounter

definition.value: Refernce to the individual that participated in the encounter, usually health care provider. Identified using Norwegian national id number (fødselsnummer). The Name of the participant should be given in the subject.display element.

Logical refernce to the individual that participated in the encounter, usually health care provider. Identified using Norwegian national id number (fødselsnummer). The Name of the participant should be given in the subject.display element.
An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

short.value: The official name of the FNR namespace

definition.value:
The official name of the FNR namespace, identified by its oid value
Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

The FNR value identifying the participant
The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

Tha name of the individual
Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

short.value: The start and end time of the digital encounter

definition.value:
Time period for the digital encounter, the system should provide both start and end times. If the start-time is not known a single end time can be provided as a timestamp for the Encounter.
Example code: ~~~ "period":{ "start":"2018-06-25T09:56:23.945+02:00", "end":"2018-06-25T10:01:03.936+02:00" } ~~~
Reason the encounter takes place, coded according to http://ehelse.no/fhir/ValueSet/vkp-encounter-reason-v05

VKP uses this refererence to name location where the digital-Encounter takes place. Typically includes only location.location.display element with a textual description of the location.
List of locations where the patient has been during this encounter.

A location reference. Only display value is supported by the VKP.
The location where the encounter takes place.

The Display value for the location. In vkp the format is usually "[room or room-number] @ [location name]".
Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.
